rules: Rule1: Whenever the video game is developed, it requires materials.
Rule2: The video game being profitable follows from it using a graphics engine.
Rule3: The video game uses a graphics engine if it has art assets.
Rule4: The video game has art assets provided that it purchased licenses.
Rule5: In the case that the video game is crowdfunded, if the game engine is optimized, then it runs smoothly.
Rule6: The video game is either venture capital backed or crowdfunded.
Rule7: The video game having a successful Kickstarter implies it has secured funding.
Rule8: The video game having secured funding leads to development being stalled if it is not the case that an investor pulls out or it is not venture capital backed.
Rule9: If the game demo is tested, then it is playable.
Rule10: The game demo is either tested or showcased.
Rule11: If the game demo is approved by the publisher, then whenever it is showcased and the game engine is buggy, the game engine crashes.
Rule12: The game demo is either approved by the publisher or rejected by the publisher.
Rule13: In the case that the game demo is rejected by the publisher, then if it is showcased and the game engine is buggy, the game engine crashes.
Rule14: If it is not the case that requiring materials implies purchased licenses for the video game, then the video game infringes copyright.
Rule15: If it is not the case that an investor pulls out or it is not venture capital backed, then development of the video game is not stalled.
Rule16: In the event that it is not the case that optimized implies runs smoothly for the game engine, the game engine is buggy.
Rule17: If it is not the case that not requiring materials implies purchased licenses leads to not infringing copyright for the video game, then a lawsuit is filed against the video game.
Rule18: Whenever the video game is not profitable, the game engine is optimized.
facts: Fact1: The video game is developed.
Fact2: The video game has a successful Kickstarter.
Fact3: It is not the case that the game engine runs smoothly.
Fact4: It is not the case that a lawsuit is filed against the video game.
Fact5: It is not the case that an investor pulls out of the video game.
Fact6: It is not the case that the game engine crashes.
Fact7: It is not the case that the game demo is playable.
